meanings.definition: Renegers: People who fail to fulfill a promise or obligation.
meanings.sent1: Some renegers never keep their promises.
meanings.sent2: The renegers disappointed everyone by not fulfilling their obligations.
meanings.sent3: The renegers in the group were known for always letting others down.
meanings.sent4: She was a reneger, always breaking her promises like shattered glass.
meanings.sent5: The renegers were like shadows, disappearing when it was time to act on their commitments.

meanings.definition: Renegers: To go back on a promise or commitment.
meanings.sent1: He renegers on his promises too often.
meanings.sent2: She renegers whenever things get tough.
meanings.sent3: The boy renegers on his agreement to share his toys.
meanings.sent4: The politician renegers on his words like a magician with disappearing acts.
meanings.sent5: She renegers so frequently that no one trusts her anymore.

meanings.definition: Renegers: The act of breaking a promise or commitment.
meanings.sent1: Breaking promises is considered renegers by many.
meanings.sent2: The renegers of trust happen when commitments are broken.
meanings.sent3: The renegers of the group led to chaos and disappointment.
meanings.sent4: The renegers of vows can shatter hearts like fragile glass.
meanings.sent5: The renegers of commitments left a trail of broken trust in their wake.
